; refers to: ; one or more of member, character, story, pattern, collage, invitation, resource
name: short name for search
text: question to ask
type: ONE of ordinal, nominal, text, boolean, value
choices: if ordinal/nominal: pipe delimited choices
help: optional text user sees as explanation
use help: optional text to explain to managers when question is best to use

name: and display
choices: if value: min | max
column7: only applies if the question is ordinal or nominal

use for: if applies to all types, leave blank
choices: if boolean: yes text | no text

name: Generation
text: Which generation do you fall into?
choices: Gen-Y | Gen-X | Baby boomers | Greatest Generation | Even older than that!

name: Know about history
text: How much do you know about the history of this area?
choices: everything | an awful lot | pretty much | some | not much | nothing at all

name: Living here ranks
text: How would you say that living in our community ranks among places you have lived?
choices: the highest | very high | high | medium | low | very low | the absolute bottom

name: Community groups
text: What community groups do you belong to?

name: Type of interest
text: Is your interest in this topic personal, professional or general?
choices: personal | professional | general

name: Feel about future
text: How do you feel about the future with regards to the topic of this group?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: Powers that be
text: Do you think that people who have charge of things in relation to this topic are doing a good job?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: How useful
text: How useful do you think this group can be to its members in relation to this topic?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Occupation
text: What is your occupation?

name: Effectiveness
text: How would you characterize the effectiveness of this work group?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: Support
text: Do you feel like you have enough support to do the work you are asked to do?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Motivated
text: Do you feel motivated in your work?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Challenged
text: Does your work challenge you?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Proud
text: How proud would you say you are of the work that gets done in this group?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Full or part time
text: Do you work full or part time?
choices: full | part

name: Parents
text: Who are your parents?

name: Grandparents
text: Who are your grandparents?

name: Where live
text: Where do you live?
help: Enter any sort of location you like, specific or vague.

name: Closeness
text: Compared to all of the families you have known, how would you characterize the closeness in this family?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: Openness
text: Compared to all of the families you have known, how would you characterize the openness and honesty in this family?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: Craziness
text: What is your favorite crazy thing about this family? What do we do that nobody else does?

name: Frustration
text: What drives you crazy about this family? What do we do that bothers you?

name: Favorite characteristic
text: What is your favorite thing about how the members of this family relate to each other?

name: Needs to see
text: Is there anyone who you think particularly needs to see this?

name: Should not see
text: Is there anyone who you think should not see this?

name: Right about
text: What does this entry say about what is right about this community or group?

name: Wrong with
text: What does this entry say about what is wrong with this community or group?

name: Together or apart
text: What does this entry say about how people in this community or group come together or fall apart?

name: Power and status
text: What does this entry say about the distribution of power and status in this community or group?

name: Rules
text: Does this entry reveal any unwritten community or group rules?

name: When happened
text: When did this story happen?
choices: very recently | recently | a while ago | a long time ago | I don't know | I can't remember

name: Useful to
text: Is there anyone you think will find this story especially useful?

name: Common
text: How common would you say the events in this story are?
choices: extremely | very | moderately | not much | not at all

name: Fictional
text: Is this story a deliberate fiction?
choices: Yes | it didn't happen | No | it really did happen

name: Main character
text: Who would you say is the main character in this story?

name: Multiple main character
text: Is the main character in this story one person or more than one?
choices: one person | more than one person

name: What changed
text: What changed in this story?

name: Conflicts
text: What conflicts do you see in this story?

name: Competition
text: Are there any instances in this story of people competing?

name: Collaboration
text: Are there any instances in this story of people collaborating?

name: Coming to aid
text: Are there any instances in this story of people coming to someone else's aid?

name: Turned out
text: Did the story turn out well or poorly?

name: Risks or challenges
text: Are there any important risks or challenges faced by characters in this story?

name: People want
text: What would you say the people in this story want?
choices: control | power | help | to be heard | affection | respect | belonging | to be left alone | nothing at all

name: Surprising
text: What in this story surprised you?

name: Proverbs
text: Does this story remind you of any proverbs or sayings?

name: Identify with
text: Is there anyone in this story you identify with?

name: Can't identify with
text: Is there anyone in this story you can't identify with?

name: Contradict
text: Does this story contradict any other stories you've heard?

name: Heard before
text: Have you heard stories like this one before?
choices: all the time | once in a while | rarely | never

name: Learned
text: What did you learn from this story?

name: Would fix story
text: What would fix the problems that appear in this story?

name: Story would fix
text: What problems would this story fix?

name: Everyday
text: Would you characterize the story as about everyday things or about something more important than that?
choices: it's about everyday things | it's about more important things

name: Can tell
text: Who can tell this story?

name: Can't tell
text: Who can't tell this story?

name: How widely can be told
text: How widely can this story be told?
choices: to anyone | only to trusted people | to hardly anyone

name: If told in public
text: If this story was told in public, say in a newspaper, would the result be good or bad for the community or group?
choices: great | good | okay | not so great | bad | awful

name: Changed over time
text: If you have heard this story before (or one like it), how has it changed over time? How has it changed when different people have told it (or ones like it)?

name: Observations
text: What pattern do you see here?
help: Please describe what is noteworthy, confining yourself to facts that anyone could agree on.

name: Intensity
text: How much emotional intensity would you say this pattern holds for you?
choices: an overwhelming amount | a lot | some but not a lot | hardly any | none at all

name: Change over time
text: Do you think this pattern is something new, or have things always been this way?
choices: things have always been this way | it has been this way for a while but not forever | this has just happened recently

name: Larger pattern
text: Do you think this pattern is part of something larger? If so, what?

name: Positive or negative
text: If you had to give this pattern a value of positive or negative, which would it be?
choices: very positive | positive | neutral | negative | very negative

name: Useful to
text: Is there anyone you think will find this pattern especially useful?

name: How created
text: How was this collage created?
help: Is there anything you think people should know about the process used to create this collage?

name: Created by person or group
text: Did any other people participate in building this collage (other than the person who entered it)?

name: Exercise
text: Was any formal exercise used to create this collage? (If so, what was it?)

name: Intensity
text: How much emotional intensity would you say this collage holds for you?
choices: an overwhelming amount | a lot | some but not a lot | hardly any | none at all

name: Refers to
text: Is this invitation in reference to an event, person, place, time, or thing?
help: Is there anything this invitation asks about in particular?

name: Why useful
text: Why are stories in response to this invitation particularly useful?

name: Setting
text: Is there a particular setting people should think of when starting to tell a story in response to this invitation?
help: For example, 'You are looking at the old bridge and you think...'

name: If no response
text: What should people do if they can't think of a story in response to this invitation?
help: For example, 'Tell about another bridge instead...'

name: Why useful
text: Why is this resource useful?

name: Stories invoked
text: What sorts of stories might people think of when they look at this resource?

name: Features of note
text: Is there anything about this resource that you want people to particularly notice?
help: For example, 'Notice how well the old bridge is holding up...'
